title: HTML Media & Images Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of HTML images, media elements, and embedding

questions.question: Which attribute defines where an image file is stored?
questions.explanation: The src attribute specifies the source (file path) of the image to display.

questions.question: What happens if the file path in src is wrong?
choices: The browser replaces it with a random cat
The page won't render at all
questions.explanation: If the file path is incorrect or the file doesn't exist, the image will not load and typically shows a broken image icon.

questions.question: Which path is correct if index.html and photo.jpg are in the same folder?
questions.explanation: When files are in the same folder, you can use './filename' or just 'filename' to reference them.

questions.question: What attribute is required to make <audio> or <video> usable for humans?
questions.explanation: The controls attribute adds play, pause, volume and other controls that users need to interact with media.

questions.question: Which element is typically used to embed a YouTube video?
questions.explanation: <iframe> allows you to embed external content like YouTube videos into your webpage.
